title: Welcome to Math with Ms. Sonoma!
subject: math
blurb: Learn how Ms. Sonoma teaches math by exploring simple addition

vocab.definition: Putting numbers together to find a total
The answer you get when you add numbers together
The word we use for the addition symbol

examples: If you have 3 apples and get 2 more apples, you now have 5 apples. That's 3 plus 2 equals 5.
When we add 4 plus 3, we can count up from 4: five, six, seven. So 4 plus 3 equals 7.
Zero is special in addition. When you add zero to any number, the number stays the same. So 5 plus 0 equals 5.
